intro: Toddalia schmidelioides, commonly known as the Mexican white cedar, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, winged seeds that are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Toddalia schmidelioides is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
